title: Week 1: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
description: An overview of the course, including the history of AI and current trends in the field.

title: Week 2: Key Concepts and Ethical Frameworks in AI
description: Exploration of fundamental definitions and distinctions between AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning, alongside an introduction to ethical considerations.

title: Week 3: Search Algorithms
description: Insight into uninformed and informed search strategies used in problem-solving within AI.

title: Week 4: Knowledge Representation
description: Discussion of how knowledge can be structured and represented in AI systems, including logic, ontologies, and frames.

title: Week 5: Expert Systems and Decision-Making
description: An examination of how expert systems are built and their role in decision support systems.

title: Week 6: Machine Learning Basics
description: Introduction to the principles of machine learning, distinguishing between supervised and unsupervised learning, and understanding the concept of overfitting.

title: Week 7: Neural Networks
description: Fundamentals of deep learning, covering network architectures and their applications.

title: Week 8: Midterm Project Checkpoint
description: A checkpoint where students present their project proposals and key concepts learned up to this point.

title: Week 9: Deep Dive into Ethical Dilemmas in AI
description: An in-depth look at ethical frameworks in AI, discussions on algorithmic bias, and case studies on ethical implications.

title: Week 10: Case Studies in AI
description: Analysis of industry-specific applications of AI and the associated ethical dilemmas revealed through case studies.

title: Week 11: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
description: Introduction to NLP techniques and their various applications within artificial intelligence.

title: Week 12: AI in Computer Vision
description: Exploration of image processing techniques and recognition tasks as they relate to AI.

title: Week 13: Societal Impacts of AI
description: Discussion on the broader economic, social, and legal implications of AI technologies in society.

title: Week 14: Project Development and Prototype Working Sessions
description: Practical sessions where students work in groups to troubleshoot and refine their projects.

title: Week 15: Final Project Presentations
description: Final presentations of student group projects, showcasing the application of learned concepts and ethical considerations.
